gurmukhi: BwNjn kY jYsy koaU dIpkY durwey rwKY mMdr mY ACq hI dUsro n jwneI
transliteration: Bhaanjan Kai Jaisay Kooo Deepakai Duraaay Raakhai , Mandar Mai Achhat Hee Doosaro N Jaanaee ?
translation: If a beacon is lit but kept under cover, no one can see anything in that room despite the presence of an oil lamp there.

gurmukhi: jau pY rKveIAw puin pRgt pRgws krY hrY qm iqmr audoq joq TwneI
transliteration: Jau Pai Rakhavaeeaa Pouni Pragat Pragaas Karai , Harai Tam Timar Udot Jot Tthaanaee ?
translation: But he who has hidden the lamp removes its cover and light up the room, the darkness of room is dispelled.

gurmukhi: sgl smgRI giiH pyiKAY pRqiC rUp dIpk idpeIAw qqKn pihcwneI
transliteration: Sagal Samagree Grihi Paykhiai Pratachhi Roopa , Deepak Dipaeeaa Tatakhan Pahichaanaee ?
translation: Then one is able to see everything and even he who has lit the lamp can be recognised.

gurmukhi: qYsy AvGt Gt gupq joqI srUp gur aupdys aunmwnI aunmwneI ]363]
transliteration: Taisay Avaghat Ghat Goupat Jotee Saroopa , Gur Oupadays Ounamaanee Ounamaanaee ?363?
translation: Similarly, God resides latently in the tenth door of this sacred and invaluable body. By the incantation blessed by the True Guru and perpetual practicing on it, one realises Him and feels His presence there. (363)
